params.data: Calldata to pass along to the position manager

exactInput((bytes,address,uint256,uint25.details: Setting `amountIn` to 0 will cause the contract to look up its own balance, and swap the entire amount, enabling contracts to send tokens before calling this function.

params.params: The parameters necessary for the multi-hop swap, encoded as `ExactInputParams` in calldata

returns.amountOut: The amount of the received token

exactInputSingle((address,address,uint24.details: Setting `amountIn` to 0 will cause the contract to look up its own balance, and swap the entire amount, enabling contracts to send tokens before calling this function.

params.params: The parameters necessary for the swap, encoded as `ExactInputSingleParams` in calldata

returns.amountOut: The amount of the received token

params.flag: token amount in a stable swap pool. 2 for 2pool, 3 for 3pool

params.params: The parameters necessary for the multi-hop swap, encoded as `ExactOutputParams` in calldata

returns.amountIn: The amount of the input token

returns.amountIn: The amount of the input token

params.flag: token amount in a stable swap pool. 2 for 2pool, 3 for 3pool

params.data: The encoded function data for each of the calls to make to this contract

returns.results: The results from each of the calls passed in via data

multicall(bytes[]).details: The `msg.value` should not be trusted for any method callable from multicall.

multicall(uint256,bytes[]).details: The `msg.value` should not be trusted for any method callable from multicall.

params.data: The encoded function data for each of the calls to make to this contract
params.deadline: The time by which this function must be called before failing

returns.results: The results from each of the calls passed in via data

pancakeV3SwapCallback(int256,int256,byte.details: In the implementation you must pay the pool tokens owed for the swap. The caller of this method must be checked to be a PancakeV3Pool deployed by the canonical PancakeV3Factory. amount0Delta and amount1Delta can both be 0 if no tokens were swapped.

params.amount0Delta: The amount of token0 that was sent (negative) or must be received (positive) by the pool by the end of the swap. If positive, the callback must send that amount of token0 to the pool.
params.amount1Delta: The amount of token1 that was sent (negative) or must be received (positive) by the pool by the end of the swap. If positive, the callback must send that amount of token1 to the pool.
params.data: Any data passed through by the caller via the IPancakeV3PoolActions#swap call

selfPermit(address,uint256,uint256,uint8.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this).

params.deadline: A timestamp, the current blocktime must be less than or equal to this timestamp
params.r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params.s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`
params.value: The amount that can be spent of token

selfPermitAllowed(address,uint256,uint25.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this)

params.expiry: The timestamp at which the permit is no longer valid
params.nonce: The current nonce of the owner
params.r: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `v` and `s`
params.s: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `v`
params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`

selfPermitAllowedIfNecessary(address,uin.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this) Can be used instead of #selfPermitAllowed to prevent calls from failing due to a frontrun of a call to #selfPermitAllowed.

params.token: The address of the token spent
params.v: Must produce valid secp256k1 signature from the holder along with `r` and `s`

selfPermitIfNecessary(address,uint256,ui.details: The `owner` is always msg.sender and the `spender` is always address(this). Can be used instead of #selfPermit to prevent calls from failing due to a frontrun of a call to #selfPermit

swapExactTokensForTokens(uint256,uint256.details: Setting `amountIn` to 0 will cause the contract to look up its own balance, and swap the entire amount, enabling contracts to send tokens before calling this function.

params.amountIn: The amount of token to swap
params.amountOutMin: The minimum amount of output that must be received
params.path: The ordered list of tokens to swap through

returns.amountOut: The amount of the received token

params.amountInMax: The maximum amount of input that the caller will pay
params.amountOut: The amount of token to swap for
params.path: The ordered list of tokens to swap through

returns.amountIn: The amount of token to pay

approveMax(address).notice: Approves a token for the maximum possible amount

approveMaxMinusOne(address).notice: Approves a token for the maximum possible amount minus one

approveZeroThenMax(address).notice: Approves a token for zero, then the maximum possible amount

approveZeroThenMaxMinusOne(address).notice: Approves a token for zero, then the maximum possible amount minus one

callPositionManager(bytes).notice: Calls the position manager with arbitrary calldata

exactInput((bytes,address,uint256,uint25.notice: Swaps `amountIn` of one token for as much as possible of another along the specified path

exactInputSingle((address,address,uint24.notice: Swaps `amountIn` of one token for as much as possible of another token

exactOutput((bytes,address,uint256,uint2.notice: Swaps as little as possible of one token for `amountOut` of another along the specified path (reversed) that may remain in the router after the swap.

exactOutputSingle((address,address,uint2.notice: Swaps as little as possible of one token for `amountOut` of another token that may remain in the router after the swap.

increaseLiquidity((address,address,uint2.notice: Calls the position manager's increaseLiquidity function

mint((address,address,uint24,int24,int24.notice: Calls the position manager's mint function

multicall(bytes32,bytes[]).notice: Call multiple functions in the current contract and return the data from all of them if they all succeed

multicall(bytes[]).notice: Call multiple functions in the current contract and return the data from all of them if they all succeed

pancakeV3SwapCallback(int256,int256,byte.notice: Called to `msg.sender` after executing a swap via IPancakeV3Pool#swap.

selfPermitAllowed(address,uint256,uint25.notice: Permits this contract to spend the sender's tokens for permit signatures that have the `allowed` parameter

selfPermitAllowedIfNecessary(address,uin.notice: Permits this contract to spend the sender's tokens for permit signatures that have the `allowed` parameter

selfPermitIfNecessary(address,uint256,ui.notice: Permits this contract to spend a given token from `msg.sender`

swapExactTokensForTokens(uint256,uint256.notice: Swaps `amountIn` of one token for as much as possible of another token

swapTokensForExactTokens(uint256,uint256.notice: Swaps as little as possible of one token for an exact amount of another token
